speaker: Frasier
text: [_on-air_] Just remember Angela, cosmetic surgery is only a superficial solution.  You can lift your eyelids, but it can't lift that little cloud of pessimism that hovers over you. Thank you for your call.  So okay Roz, who's our next caller?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz?  Perhaps this would be a good time to go to commercial break.  We'll be right back after these messages. _He goes off the air and walks into Roz's booth, looks into the corridor, spots Roz coming back and hides behind the door.  Roz comes running in, sits down and realizes Frasier's not where he's supposed to be._

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier? [_he tilts her seat back so she can see him_] Whoa! Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: A little disturbing, looking in the booth and seeing no one there, isn't it?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry, but I was up in the newsroom, trying to find out if they've announced the nominations for the SeaBeas yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I forgot.  Are those coming out today?

speaker: Roz
text: You forgot?  They're only the biggest award in Seattle radio!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose it's the difference in our ages, but I don't find myself getting excited about... well, much of anything anymore.

speaker: Noel
text: Congratulations, guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: YES!!!  Yes, we got a nomination!

speaker: Roz
text: Who did you hear it from?

speaker: Noel
text: Oh, I haven't heard anything, I was just congratulating you on doing a great show.  If anyone deserves a nomination, you guys do.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_growling_] Get out, Noel.

speaker: Noel
text: Okay, catch you later. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I... I guess I'm a little more excited than I let on. Well, it'll be a big feather in my cap to win this, first year in radio and all that? [_goes into recording booth_]

speaker: Roz
text: Are you kidding?  I've been in this business for ten years, I've never produced a show that got nominated for anything. [_phone rings, she answers_] Hello?  Oh hi, Millie.  You're kidding.  You're kidding! [_Frasier comes racing back_] Oh, you're kidding, that's great!  Thanks, bye. [_puts phone down_]

speaker: Frasier
text: We got the nomination!

speaker: Roz
text: No, Millie in Promotions is getting married!

speaker: Frasier
text: DAMN IT, ROZ! _FADE OUT  Scene B: Cafe Nervosa. Frasier and Niles are having coffee._

speaker: Niles
text: And then she said she'd been seeing someone else.  She couldn't keep living a lie.  I was dumbfounded.  I mean, what about everything we'd gone through together, didn't that mean anything to her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, a patient has a right to change therapists.

speaker: Bebe
text: Frasier!  Thank God.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, what are you doing here?

speaker: Bebe
text: What kind of agent would I be if I weren't the first to tell you that you've been nominated for a 1994 SeaBea!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_jumps up_] I WAS NOMINATED!  I WAS NOMINATED!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I was.

speaker: Bebe
text: Yes.  You, Frasier Crane M.D., PhD, S-T-U-D, are the man of the hour. [_notices Niles_] Bebe Glaser, Frasier's agent.

speaker: Niles
text: Dr. Niles Crane, Frasier's brother.

speaker: Bebe
text: You're not a psychiatrist too?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Bebe
text: Oh, please!  If I'm ever to have a breakdown, let me have it now! [_to Niles_] Double-double decaf, to go.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, this, ah, this is quite a surprise, you know.  Actually I'd, ah, forgotten that the nominations were coming out today.

speaker: Bebe
text: Oh, isn't he precious?  You must be very proud of Frasier.

speaker: Niles
text: Well actually... no.  This nomination is just one more signpost on the low road of celebrity which my brother has chosen for himself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's not sibling rivalry rearing its vicious little green snout?

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely not.  I'm still in the minority who still believes that psychiatry is a noble profession that is tarnished by such things as popularity contests, not to mention a bouncy little radio program.

speaker: Bebe
text: I bet you two had wicked little hair-pulling fights when you were tots.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well.  This has been delightful, but I really must run. I'm due at my sexual addiction group, and I don't like to leave them alone for too long. [_he leaves as Roz enters_]

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, Frasier, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Roz, Roz! [_they hug and do a little dance_]

speaker: Roz
text: We did it!

speaker: Frasier
text: I know!  Come and sit down.  You know, I've never really won anything before.  Although back in prep school, the Existentialist Club once named me "Most Likely To Be."

speaker: Roz
text: You want to hear the greatest part?  I've already got a date for the ceremony - Brad MacNamara.

speaker: Frasier
text: The Channel Eight reporter?  "Television's Most Handsome Man."

speaker: Roz
text: Yes.  You know, for months he wouldn't give me the time of day, but one nomination and he knew who I was.

speaker: Bebe
text: Who are you?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm Roz Doyle.  Frasier's producer.

speaker: Bebe
text: Oh, yes that's right, I've seen you bring him coffee.  By the way, would you mind getting mine?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd better get myself on the ball here, I've got a lot to do.

speaker: Bebe
text: Oh, not really, darling.  I've already got your tux, rented you a limo and your tickets will be waiting for you at the door.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... seems the only thing you haven't taken care of is finding me a date.

speaker: Bebe
text: Your subtlety floors me, I'd love to.  I am thrilled, thrilled, thrilled for you both.  I've got to run.  Two of my other clients weren't nominated and I have to tell them what a worthless award this is. **ROZ AND FRASIER HATCH A MERRY PLAN**  _Scene C: Frasier's Apartment. He is opening a bottle of champagne.  Martin and Daphne are watching._

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, you may not be aware of this, but there is a special secret to opening a bottle of champagne, especially a fine French champagne as unprepossessing as this one -- two hundred dollars a bottle.  In order to prevent spillage, one does not simply twist out the cork.  Instead, one holds the cork stationary, you see, and then gives the bottle three easy turns.  One...

speaker: Frasier
text: OH, GOD!  Oh no, get some glasses! _Eddie starts licking the spillage from the table.  Frasier shoos him away._

speaker: Frasier
text: Eddie, get away from there, you mangy little cur!  Oh, Lord. Oh well, that wasn't too bad, I believe we've salvaged most of it.

speaker: Martin
text: I'd say this calls for a toast.  To my number one son. Congratulations on your first nomination for... well, anything.  Frasier, I'm proud of you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, dad.  Means a lot to me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mmm.  Oh, this champagne is delicious.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm.  It's quite exquisite, isn't it?  Dad, what do you think?  _Martin returns from the kitchen with a beer, which he pours into his champagne glass._

speaker: Martin
text: I was in the mood for something domestic.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I must say, Dr. Crane, it's awfully nice that, although I'm an employee here, you include me in all the family celebrations.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Daphne, there's never been any doubt that I, I think of you as my equal in every way. _The doorbell rings. Frasier sits down while Daphne sips her champagne. When it rings again, Frasier glares at her until she moves._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sarcastically_] Oh, I'll get it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, would you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Would you like me to announce your visitor?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just answer the door!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_answering door_] Oh, hello Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_entering_] Daphne.

speaker: Martin
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Hey.

speaker: Daphne
text: Congratulations.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thanks.  You know, I couldn't believe it myself.  Brad MacNamara!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I believe she was referring to your SeaBea nomination?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I meant Brad MacNamara.  Oh, do you think he wears any pants under that desk?

speaker: Roz
text: Not on my TV.

speaker: Frasier
text: Girls, can we just cut out the pajama party, please?

speaker: Roz
text: [_to Martin_] Hello, Mr. C.

speaker: Martin
text: [_taps his cheek_] Hey Roz, how's my girlfriend?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, [_gives him a kiss_] she's nominated.

speaker: Daphne
text: How about a glass of champagne?  Apparently it's French and unprepossessing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Daphne, save your breath.  It could come out of a box and Roz would have a glass of it.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I must say, I am so proud of you, Roz, being recognized in a male-dominated industry.  It's one more step forward for working women.  You're a credit to our gender.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, thank you Daphne.  Oh, that reminds me, do you have a push-up bra I could borrow?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll go and look. [_exits_]

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks. [_to Frasier_] I'm sorry to barge in like this, but I had to show you this, Frasier. [_retrieves a piece of newspaper from her bag_] I've got a friend over at "Broadcast Magazine" who sent me a copy.  It's a full-page ad.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reading_] "Wendy Ashiro wishes to thank the members of the voting committee for her nomination, and hopes they consider her for the award."  This is nothing but shameless self- promotion.  It's in very bad taste.

speaker: Roz
text: I know.  What are we gonna put in our ad?

speaker: Martin
text: Wendy Ashiro's up against you for this award?  Oh, I like her, she's a cutie.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're not suggesting we put our own ad in this thing?

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, we're falling behind.  Mike Sanchez has already sent out tapes of his show.

speaker: Martin
text: Mike Sanchez?  Oh, I like him.

speaker: Roz
text: And who knows what Fletcher Grey's doing?

speaker: Martin
text: Fletcher Grey?

speaker: Frasier
text: THANK YOU, DAD! [_to Roz, about the ad_] Well, all right, I-- just as long as it's tasteful and understated.

speaker: Roz
text: Great.  I'll call my friend, and have him work something up for us.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, wait a minute, wait a minute, we really want to stand out, why run another boring old ad?  We should do something different, something unique.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, I heard last year's winner threw a big cocktail party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, okay, we could do that, but we should do something else, something to keep our names in their minds.  You know what I mean?  Uh, I know.  Personalized gifts, uh, from oh, the new Tiffany's catalogue. [_picks it up_]

speaker: Roz
text: That's good.  That's it.

speaker: Frasier
text: I saw the most incredible cigarette cases in here.

speaker: Roz
text: No, no.  No cigarette cases, it sends out a bad message.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yeah.

speaker: Roz
text: Ooh, how about a silver flask?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, we've already got your vote, Roz.

speaker: Martin
text: Hold on a minute.  Look, I may not know anything about show- business, but when you start sending out gifts to people who can do something for you, that's called bribery.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a simple "Thank you" for a nomination.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm glad to hear that. [_takes catalogue_] Because if I had to give somebody a gift to get an award, it's not worth having.  Might as well just go on down to the trophy store and buy one yourself. [_throws catalogue on fire, then exits_]

speaker: Roz
text: I really want that award.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me too!

speaker: Roz
text: Get that catalogue!    **THE PLOT THICKENS** _Scene A: The Seattle Broadcast Awards. A black tie affair.  Martin and Frasier are standing by the door._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you coming in or not?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, this is a big moment for me.  I want to drink it in.

speaker: Martin
text: Me, too.  Where's the bar?

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, not so fast.  Me shoes are killing me.  I hate these shoes, I should never have let that salesgirl talk me into getting them.

speaker: Martin
text: They look real good on you, though.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_brightening up_] You think so?

speaker: Peterson
text: Dr. Crane?  Bob Peterson, voting committee. [_they shake hands_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Bob.

speaker: Peterson
text: Look, I just wanted to wish you good luck tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, thank you.

speaker: Peterson
text: Oh, and uh, thanks for the bathrobe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's nothing.  People get out of the shower, they're cold.

speaker: Woman
text: Dr. Crane.  Love the watch. [_indicates her wristwatch_]

speaker: Frasier
text: It's nothing, really.  It's a pretty good likeness of me though, isn't it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Can we please sit down?  I have got to sit down. [_she sits at the nearest table_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, we're at table eight.  This isn't our table.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_ripping up the card with the table number on it_] It is now.

speaker: Martin
text: [_indicating distinguished man_] Hey, isn't that Fletcher Grey?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, I believe it is.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh boy, you really got your work cut out for you here.  Let me tell you, that guy's a class act.  I been listening to him for twenty years.  You know, I don't usually do this, but I'm going over to shake his hand. [_leaves table as Roz enters_]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz.  There's my fellow nominee.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, those gifts were such a great idea.  Everybody's talking about them.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know.  Did you see the valet parking board? Half the key chains there are ours!

speaker: Roz
text: Look, Frasier, this is a very big night for me, so please, PLEASE don't spoil it by making fun of who I brought.

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought you were bringing Brad MacNamara?

speaker: Roz
text: Well I was, but he got called out on a story at the last minute.  Some hospital went up in flames.  Do you know anyone who has worse luck than I do?

speaker: Noel
text: Hi, Dr. Crane. [_gives Vulcan peace salute_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi Noel. [_to Roz, quietly_] Noel Shempsky's your date?

speaker: Roz
text: Mmm-hmm.

speaker: Noel
text: [_arrives at table and puts his arm around Roz_] A tip, Dr. Crane?  If you're ever nominated again, there's a metered parking block three blocks away.  They don't check after six! [_to Roz_] Oh, here are the car keys so you can drive us home. [_to Frasier_] I have night blindness. [_goes to table_]

speaker: Roz
text: I wish I did.

speaker: Noel
text: [_sits next to Daphne_] Hi.  I'm Noel.

speaker: Daphne
text: Nice to meet you.  Can you rub my feet?

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne!

speaker: Niles
text: Good evening, everybody.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi Niles.  Listen, thank you so much for coming.  I know how you feel about this award, and about coming downtown after dark.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't be silly.  You're my brother and I wouldn't miss a gala affair like this.  Hello, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Can you rub my feet?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stopping him_] Niles.  So, where's Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we were just getting ready to leave the house, when Maris got a glimpse of herself in the hall mirror...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, at the end of this story, will I roll my eyes?

speaker: Niles
text: I did.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well then, just skip it.  Listen, get me a scotch, will you?

speaker: Martin
text: [_returning_] That Fletcher Grey, he's aces.  Would you believe he remembered me from 1968?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I was working on a murder case he was covering.  He just looked at me and said, "Hey, you're the guy who found the head."  He's been nominated for this award eleven times and he's never won it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Jeez, I didn't know that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm afraid he's just going to have to lose again, right Dr. Crane?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if he does you can always cheer him up by sending him something nice from your little gift shop.

speaker: Fletcher
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Fletcher Grey!

speaker: Fletcher
text: Been meaning to come over and wish you luck.  Even though I don't think you need it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's very kind.  I, I hardly think I have a chance against you tonight.

speaker: Fletcher
text: Well you know, I hope you're right?  I'd really love to win it this time.  Eleven losses in a row, it's starting to get a little embarrassing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't be silly.  You'd have to lose fifteen, sixteen times before you'd feel the least bit ashamed.

speaker: Fletcher
text: Would you believe I even considered campaigning for it this year?  You know, sending out gifts, throwing one on those parties.  Bet you'd have something to say on your radio program about someone who's THAT self-absorbed.

speaker: Martin
text: I bet he could do a whole hour on it.

speaker: Mrs. Grey
text: Fletcher dear, they're starting to serve the salads.

speaker: Fletcher
text: Oh, Mom. [_to Frasier_] I'm sixty years old, and I'm still her little boy. Dr. Crane, I'd like you to meet my mother, Hannah.

speaker: Frasier
text: What a pleasure, Hannah.  Nice to meet you.

speaker: Fletcher
text: Mom just flew in from Scottsdale.  This is her eleventh year.

speaker: Mrs. Grey
text: I hope he wins it this time.  It's getting harder and harder to get on that plane.

speaker: Fletcher
text: Mom, why don't you go back to the table before your legs swell up?  I'll get you another Pink Lady.  No, no mom, over there.

speaker: Bebe
text: Sorry I've been detained, dear.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hi, Bebe.

speaker: Bebe
text: Civilization will not advance one iota until they start putting more toilets in the ladies room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you Niles.

speaker: Bebe
text: [_to Niles_] Some champagne.

speaker: Noel
text: Ah, a diet root beer?

speaker: Bebe
text: I have to tell you that the buzz in line was that all those lovely gifts you've been sending have really paid off.  It looks like you're in a neck-and-neck race with Fletcher Grey, that wrinkled old war... [_notices Martin_] ...rt. Hello, Mr. Crane.  You're even more handsome than the last time I saw you.  If I were twenty years older they couldn't keep me away from you.

speaker: Martin
text: That's why I keep this cane.

speaker: Keith
text: Good evening, ladies and gentlemen.  Would everybody please take their seats?  I'm Keith Bishop, and I'd like to welcome you to the fifteenth annual SeaBea awards.  Assisting me tonight in handing out the awards is Miss SeaBea 1994, Tawny Van Deusen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen Roz, I'm starting to feel uncomfortable about all the campaigning we did.  Did you know Fletcher Grey has been nominated eleven times and never won?  He didn't lift a finger to win this thing.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, don't worry about him.  Besides, he can win it next year.

speaker: Keith
text: Before we start this evening's program, I'd like to take this moment to make a very sad announcement.  I just found out moments ago that the dean of Seattle radio, my mentor Fletcher Grey, will be retiring this year.

speaker: All
text: Awww...

speaker: Keith
text: Take a bow, Fletcher.

speaker: Keith
text: Well, we're gonna start things off with a bang.  The award for "Outstanding Achievement For Informational Programming in Radio..."

speaker: Roz
text: That's us, that's us!

speaker: Keith
text: Whoops.  Can't see a thing without my glasses.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Fletcher Grey really deserves this award.  If we win, can't we just not accept it?

speaker: Roz
text: [_grabbing him by the shirt_] Listen, Frasier!  I have waited ten years to get this award and if I have to crawl over Fletcher Grey's mother to get it, I'll DO IT!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I... I've never seen you like this before.

speaker: Roz
text: It isn't pretty, is it?

speaker: Keith
text: The nominations: "Community Forum," Wendy Ashiro, talent, Mike Freedman, producer.

speaker: Keith
text: "Consumer Update," Mike Sanchez, talent, T.J. "Chester" Nuevo, producer.

speaker: Keith
text: "The Frasier Crane Show," Dr. Frasier Crane, talent, Roz Doyle, producer.

speaker: Keith
text: "Fletcher Grey: From Where I Sit," Fletcher Grey, talent, Fletcher Grey, producer.

speaker: Keith
text: And the envelope, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: If we win this thing, they're gonna lynch us!

speaker: Roz
text: So what?  At least everyone will see my dress.

speaker: Keith
text: Well... this is a first.  It seems we have a tie.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good.  We can share it with Fletcher.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't want to share it!  I'm already sharing it with you!

speaker: Keith
text: And the winners are... Wendy Ashiro and Mike Sanchez!

speaker: Frasier
text: What??

speaker: Roz
text: What!!

speaker: Mrs. Grey
text: What? **THE THRILLING DENOUEMENT**  _Scene B: Time Lapse. The staff are cleaning up.  Roz and Frasier are still drowning their sorrows._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, the party's over.  Are you coming home?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Then I'll guess we'll just go on without you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine with me.

speaker: Martin
text: Listen, Frasier.  I don't agree with the way you went about it, but I'm still sorry that you lost.  It's never easy to lose.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Of course, if you were to have joined some organized sports when you were a kid, when the lessons of winning and losing could have been learned at an early age, you might have...

speaker: Frasier
text: DAD!

speaker: Martin
text: All right.  Sorry, wrong time.  We'll talk about it tomorrow, over breakfast.  Okay, Daphne.  Let's get you home, and soak your feet in some hot Epsom Salts.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I have the life of a princess. [_they leave_]

speaker: Noel
text: Don't feel bad, Roz. it's an honor just to get a nomination.

speaker: Roz
text: Will you stop saying that?

speaker: Noel
text: Okay.  I'm leaving.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh Noel, I'm sorry, I'm just despondent. [_he waits, expectantly_] ...No no, go ahead. [_waves him away_]

speaker: Frasier
text: ROZ!

speaker: Roz
text: Noel?  Noel?  I'm sorry.  Thank you.  I'll see you at work, on Monday?

speaker: Fletcher
text: How you guys doing?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I've been better.

speaker: Fletcher
text: You know, when you feel this sting of losing, you have to realize that it all boils down to the fact that it's not about awards.  It's not about accolades.  It's about a body of work.  If you can look at yourself in a mirror and say you've done a good job, that's all that matters. If you can do that, let the awards fall where they may.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wow.  All those nominations, nothing to show for it, he still walks out of here with his head held high and a smile on his face.

speaker: Roz
text: [_bursting into tears_] I'm never going to get nominated for a SeaBea again!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: I mean it, I'm not!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no.

speaker: Roz
text: The world is full of winners and losers, and I'm just a loser!

speaker: Frasier
text: Aw, I wouldn't be with you if you were a loser.  Come on, we're a team.  Look, before we're done, we're gonna win lots of these things.  You and I are amigos, compadres, okay?  Now listen, I am not gonna leave your side until I see a little smile on that face.

speaker: Tawny
text: Dr. Crane?  I really love your show, and I was just wondering, would you like to have a drink with me?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Roz_] Do I see the beginning of a little smile?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, go ahead.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, it's a very interesting name you have.

speaker: Tawny
text: You mean Miss SeaBea?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well actually, I, er... yeah.
